byline.contributor: Gardiner Harris contributed reporting from Washington.

abstract: Federal Aviation Admin issues rules governing commercial use of drones, making it easier for many companies to use devices as part of business; drones under 55 pounds will be generally allowed, though with number of restrictions, including rule that precludes their use for deliveries.

headline.print_headline: F.A.A. Rules Make Way for Commercial Drones to Take Flight

snippet: Previously, companies had to apply for special permission to operate drones. Now a range of businesses may use drones under 55 pounds, but not for package delivery.
lead_paragraph: Previously, companies had to apply for special permission to operate drones. Now a range of businesses may use drones under 55 pounds, but not for package delivery.
